meanings.definition: A person who has narrow, restricted, or limited views, especially in regards to culture or politics.
meanings.sent1: The provincialists in the town only liked traditional music.
meanings.sent2: The provincialists refused to try new foods from different cultures.
meanings.sent3: The provincialists thought watching movies was a waste of time.
meanings.sent4: She was a provincialist when it came to fashion, always sticking to the same style.
meanings.sent5: The provincialists' closed-mindedness prevented them from appreciating diverse art forms.

meanings.definition: A group of individuals who prioritize the interests of their own region or locality over those of the nation as a whole.
meanings.sent1: The provincialists fought for better roads in their town.
meanings.sent2: The provincialists advocated for policies that benefited only their community.
meanings.sent3: The provincialists organized a local festival to celebrate their town's history.
meanings.sent4: Their group was like a small island, a provincialist enclave within the larger nation.
meanings.sent5: The provincialists' loyalty to their region was unwavering, even in times of national crisis.
